articles.author: Ankush Das
articles.description: An open-source password manager with a pleasing user interface, available cross-platform. Let's take a look!
articles.title: Padloc: An Intuitive Open-Source Password Manager

articles.author: Abhishek Prakash
articles.description: This quick tutorial shows the steps for installing the latest version of Vim on Ubuntu-based Linux distributions.
articles.title: How to Install Latest Vim 9.0 on Ubuntu Based Linux Distributions

articles.author: Sagar Sharma
articles.description: SpiralLinux aims to provide a simplified and out-of-the-box Debian experience. Does it succeed in doing so? Read in this review.
articles.title: SpiralLinux: The New Distro Making Debian Easier for Beginners

articles.author: Sagar Sharma
articles.description: Docks are one of the several ways you can customize your desktop. Here are some of the best docks that will help you change the default look of your desktop Linux.
articles.title: 7 Docks to Customize Your Linux Desktop

articles.author: Ankush Das
articles.description: A comparison of the two of the most popular open source office software that are also similar in many respects. This article explains the similarities and differences between LibreOffice and OpenOffice.
articles.title: LibreOffice vs OpenOffice: All You Need to Know?

articles.author: Abhishek Prakash
articles.description: If you love using Flatpak applications, here are a few tips, tools, and tweaks to make your Flatpak experience better and smoother.
articles.title: 6 Tips and Tools to Enhance Your Flatpak Experience in Linux

articles.author: Abhishek Prakash
articles.description: Koodo is an open source, cross-platform eBook reader application with tons of features to improve your reading experience.
articles.title: Koodo is an All-in-one Open Source eBook Reader App for Linux

articles.author: Anuj Sharma
articles.description: Pamac is an awesome GUI-based package manager from the developers of Manjaro Linux. Here's how you can get Pamac in Arch Linux.
articles.title: How to Install Pamac GUI Package Manager in Arch Linux

articles.author: Ankush Das
articles.description: It isn't rocket science to play music on Linux, but you should have a great experience with a good music player!
articles.title: Top 10 Best Music Players for Linux in 2022

articles.author: Abhishek Prakash
articles.description: Keeping on seeing a persistent "pending update of Firefox snap" message that doesn't go away even if you restart the browser or the Ubuntu system? Here's what you should do.
articles.title: Fixing the “Pending Update of Firefox snap” Error in Ubuntu

articles.author: Abhishek Prakash
articles.description: The apt command usually upgrades the entire upgradable packages at once. Here's how to upgrade only a single package or a selected few packages in Ubuntu.
articles.title: Update a Single Package With apt Command in Ubuntu and Debian

articles.author: Abhishek Prakash
articles.description: Installing deb files is quite simple. Removing deb files might not be that simple but it's not too complicated either. Here's all you need to know about deleting deb packages from Ubuntu Linux.
articles.title: How to Uninstall Deb Packages in Ubuntu

articles.author: Anuj Sharma
articles.description: Discord is a popular service among open source communities. Learn to install the desktop client of Discord on Manjaro and other Arch-based Linux distros.
articles.title: How to Install Discord on Manjaro and Other Arch Linux Derivatives

articles.author: Sagar Sharma
articles.description: AppFlowy aims to be an open-source replacement to Notion, providing you with better privacy. Let us explore more about it.
articles.title: AppFlowy: An Open-Source Alternative to Notion

articles.author: Abhishek Prakash
articles.description: Nautilus, aka GNOME Files, is a good file manager with plenty of features. You can further enhance your experience by using these extensions, tweaks and tips.
articles.title: 13 Ways to Tweak Nautilus File Manager in Linux to Get More Out of it

articles.author: Ankush Das
articles.description: Though it is not officially available, it's not that complicated to use Epic Games Store on Linux. Here are various ways you can play Epic games in Linux.
articles.title: The Ultimate Guide to Epic Games Store on Linux

articles.author: Abhishek Prakash
articles.description: Tried running python command but Ubuntu complains that python command is not found? It may already be installed but you'll still see the error. Here's why!
articles.title: Fixing “Command ‘python’ not found” Error in Ubuntu Linux

articles.author: Abhishek Prakash
articles.description: Neofetch displays the system information and distribution logo in the terminal. It can be tweaked to change the looks and feel of its output in surprising new ways.
articles.title: 9 Rather Unknown Ways of Using Neofetch in Linux

articles.author: Abhishek Prakash
articles.description: You don't always have to upgrade all the packages at once. With apt command, you can list the upgradable packages first and then decide which ones to upgrade.
articles.title: List Upgradable Packages With apt Command in Ubuntu

articles.author: Ankush Das
articles.description: An app to help you explore research photos, and documents without losing out on important contextual information about them.
articles.title: Tropy: An Open-Source App to Organize Your Research Photos

articles.author: Sagar Sharma
articles.description: In dire need of using Microsoft Office on your Linux desktop? Here are your options for getting MS Office on Linux.
articles.title: How to Use Microsoft Office on Linux

articles.author: Pratham Patel
articles.description: Want to set up a homelab but not comfortable with all the complexity? Umbrel enables you to self host multiple open source software easily.
articles.title: Umbrel: Unique Linux Distro for Self Hosting Open Source Software for Your Homelab

articles.author: Abhishek Prakash
articles.description: Think Linux terminal is all about serious work? Think again. Here are a few fun things you can do with ASCII art in the terminal.
articles.title: 10 Tools to Generate and Have Fun With ASCII Art in Linux Terminal

articles.author: Abhishek Prakash
articles.description: Development for Linux Mint 21 is going in full swing. Here is a sneak peek into the features of this much awaited distribution release.
articles.title: 12 New Features in Linux Mint 21

articles.author: Marius Nestor
articles.description:
KDE Plasma 5.25.4 is now available as a bugfix release to the latest Plasma 5.25 desktop environment series improving the Plasma Wayland session, Discover, and many other components.
The post KDE Plasma 5.25.4 Improves Plasma Wayland for Steam Proton Games, Fixes More Bugs appeared first on 9to5Linux - do not reproduce this article without permission. This RSS feed is intended for readers, not scrapers.
articles.title: KDE Plasma 5.25.4 Improves Plasma Wayland for Steam Proton Games, Fixes More Bugs

articles.author: Marius Nestor
articles.description:
GNOME 43 alpha is now available for public testing as the first development milestone towards the final GNOME 43 desktop environment, due for release in late September 2022.
The post GNOME 43 Alpha Released to Kick Off GUADEC 2022 in Guadalajara, Mexico appeared first on 9to5Linux - do not reproduce this article without permission. This RSS feed is intended for readers, not scrapers.
articles.title: GNOME 43 Alpha Released to Kick Off GUADEC 2022 in Guadalajara, Mexico

articles.author: Marius Nestor
articles.description:
GNOME 42.3 is now available as the third point release in the GNOME 42 desktop environment series with more bug fixes and improvements. Here’s what’s new!
The post GNOME 42.3 Released with Screenshot UI Fixes, Better Flatpak Support, and More appeared first on 9to5Linux - do not reproduce this article without permission. This RSS feed is intended for readers, not scrapers.
articles.title: GNOME 42.3 Released with Screenshot UI Fixes, Better Flatpak Support, and More

articles.author: Marius Nestor
articles.description:
KDE Plasma 5.25.3 is now available as the third maintenance update to the latest Plasma 5.25 desktop environment series with more bug fixes. All users should update their installations as soon as possible!
The post KDE Plasma 5.25.3 Is Out Now with More Plasma Wayland Fixes, Various Other Changes appeared first on 9to5Linux - do not reproduce this article without permission. This RSS feed is intended for readers, not scrapers.
articles.title: KDE Plasma 5.25.3 Is Out Now with More Plasma Wayland Fixes, Various Other Changes

articles.author: Marius Nestor
articles.description:
KDE Plasma 5.24.6 is now available as the sixth maintenance update to the Plasma 5.24 LTS desktop environment series with many bug fixes and improvements for more reliable and stable Plasma sessions.
The post KDE Plasma 5.24.6 LTS Brings Many Fixes to Plasma Wayland, System Settings, and More appeared first on 9to5Linux - do not reproduce this article without permission. This RSS feed is intended for readers, not scrapers.
articles.title: KDE Plasma 5.24.6 LTS Brings Many Fixes to Plasma Wayland, System Settings, and More

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: It's a fresh month which means a new curated monthly bundle with the Humble Choice, so here's what's inside and what you can expect on Linux and Steam Deck.
articles.title: Humble Choice has The Ascent, Hot Wheels Unleashed, A Plague Tale: Innocence

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: DXVK is a Direct3D to Vulkan translation layer used in Proton, to help run Windows games on Linux and Steam Deck. A new release version 1.10.3 is out now.
articles.title: DXVK 1.10.3 out with work for Halo Infinite plus better Stray performance for Proton

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Go on a bit of adventure as a Wizard in Scrabdackle, you just have to find your wand first. This scribbly-art hand-drawn adventure is ridiculously charming.
articles.title: Check out the new Scrabdackle demo, a scribbly hand-drawn Zelda-like adventure

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Frogun is a brand new Native Linux release, designed in the spirit of the PlayStation 1 and Nintendo 64 era, this is a proper classic 3D platformer.
articles.title: Frogun is a 3D platformer with the soul of a Nintendo 64 game

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Love exploration and mining? Want to do it with many explosions? Check out the new Native Linux release of BLASTRONAUT.
articles.title: BLASTRONAUT is a fresh mining game full of explosions

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Keeping a great many classics alive with new game engines, ScummVM version 2.6.0 is officially out now.
articles.title: ScummVM 2.6.0 out now with more retro game support

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: The free and open source first-person strategy shooter Unvanquished has a new Beta release, which is quite a big one too overall on what's changed.
articles.title: Free first-person strategy shooter Unvanquished version 0.53 out now

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Shadows of Adam is a JRPG inspired retro game from Something Classic Games that released back in 2017 and a small update came recently to improve it on Linux and Steam Deck.
articles.title: Inspired by classic JRPGs, Shadows of Adam gets improved Linux and Steam Deck support

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Valve has put out their usual monthly Steam Hardware & Software Survey and it's looking like good news for Linux and Steam Deck once again.
articles.title: Linux user share on Steam continues rising — highest for years again

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Valve has released a small update to the Steam Deck Beta branch, mostly bug fixes but also an improvement for handling external displays. Here's what's new.
articles.title: Steam Deck Beta update brings bug fixes, external display improvement

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Consider this your quick tip of the week, as Republique from developer Camouflaj is now free to keep on Steam and it's also Steam Deck Verified!
articles.title: Stealth-action game Republique is now FREE and Steam Deck Verified

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: While many will no doubt wait on Valve for the official Steam Deck Dock, a lot of hardware vendors are coming out with their own versions. JSAUX are one of them and they sent over their Docking Station for Steam Deck for me to take a look at.
articles.title: No need to wait on Valve, the Steam Deck Docking Station from JSAUX is great

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Valve recently released an update for the main Steam client, which amongst other things brings support in Steam Input for the Nintendo Online classic controllers.
articles.title: Steam gets support for Nintendo Online classic controllers

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: There's a lot of places where developers can have their game logo across Steam, and some developers have been going pretty overboard with noisy images filled with extras. Valve is putting a stop to it.
articles.title: Valve bans devs from adding review scores and awards on Steam store assets

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Minecraft Java Edition 1.19.1 is out now and it comes with some controversial changes, that many players are not particularly happy about.
articles.title: Mojang rolls out Player Chat Reporting into Minecraft Java

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: MangoHud is probably one of my favourite open source projects giving Linux gamers a fancy HUD to display various performance metrics in a nice overlay. Version 0.6.8 is out now!
articles.title: Linux gaming overlay MangoHud version 0.6.8 out now

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Razer make some pretty fancy hardware but, like a lot of vendors, don't exactly support Linux directly and so the OpenRazer project helps you out there.
articles.title: OpenRazer new release adding support for more Razer hardware on Linux

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: The latest kernel release is out with Linux 5.19 and showing just how far Linux support for the newer Apple silicon MacBooks has come, Linus Torvalds did the release on one!
articles.title: Linux 5.19 is out now, Torvalds released it using an Apple silicon MacBook

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Windows compatibility on Linux continues to improve thanks to Wine, with the latest development release out now with Wine 7.14 available.
articles.title: Windows compatibility layer Wine version 7.14 is out now

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Need some new games for the weekend? Humble Bundle have put up the Amazing Adventures Bundle and there are a couple of gems in it so let's take a look.
articles.title: The Humble Amazing Adventures Bundle has some gems in it

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Valve has announced that they've sorted out various issues with their Steam Deck supply chain, so they will get through reservations much faster than expected now.
articles.title: Valve speeds up Steam Deck production some more, all existing reservations this year

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Yars: Recharged is the latest remake from Atari with developers Adamvision Studios and SneakyBox and it's launching on August 23rd with Native Linux support.
articles.title: Yars: Recharged from Atari launches August 23rd

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Do you want to play the classic Diablo RPG? Well, not only does GOG have it and the Hellfire expansion but the Native Linux devilutionX game engine can make it even better. Here's how to get it working on Steam Deck (and Linux desktop!).
articles.title: Modern Diablo game engine devilutionX sees new release, how to get it on Steam Deck

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Valve has released the latest update to Proton Experimental, the special version of Proton you can use that has the latest updates bringing more game compatibility to Linux and Steam Deck.
articles.title: Proton Experimental brings support for Unravel Two, fixes up Civilization IV

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: The game store itch.io is running another Creator Day, this is where they don't take any cut from developers.
articles.title: itch.io has another Creator Day live with 100% going to developers

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Looking for your next RPG-shooter hybrid with online co-op? OUTRIDERS from People Can Fly recently released the WORLDSLAYER expansion and it's now actually Playable on the Steam Deck (and Linux desktop too).
articles.title: OUTRIDERS officially gets a Playable Steam Deck rating

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Just King is going to be my next game to be fixated on. It's ridiculously cheap and offers up gameplay where you keep wanting to come back for more.
articles.title: Just King blends Vampire Survivors action with Slay the Spire progression

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Yes this is a real thing, DOOM modders will quite literally do anything and I'm here loving it. You can now play DOOM as the cat from Stray.
articles.title: You can now play DOOM as the Cat from Stray

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Bottles is the free and open source app that allows you to easily manage Wine, the Windows compatibility layer on Steam Deck and Linux. Another new version is live, with a whole new versioning system to help you roll back changes.
articles.title: Wine manager app Bottles makes rolling back configs real easy

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Recently I showed off Halo Infinite running quite nicely online on the Steam Deck and now GE-Proton 7-27 that just went up makes the process even smoother and the campaign and videos now work too.
articles.title: GE-Proton 7-27 has the Halo Infinite campaign and videos working on Steam Deck & Linux

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Cave Monsters has released their detective adventure game Lord Winklebottom Investigates with Native Linux support.
articles.title: Detective adventure Lord Winklebottom Investigates is out now

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: One we apparently missed that arrived with Native Linux support back in May, Voodoo Detective is a Monkey Island inspired point-and-click adventure from Short Sleeve Studio.
articles.title: Voodoo Detective is a Monkey Island inspired point-and-click adventure

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Valve has released a new SteamOS Beta update for Steam Deck and it finally sorts out the Firefox situation, along with hints of hardware changes, or a new controller coming? Plus a Steam Deck Client Beta update too!
articles.title: Steam Deck Beta gets Firefox as Flatpak, mentions "future controller hardware revisions"

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Gimme! The Excavation of Hob's Barrow is an upcoming adventure from developer Cloak and Dagger Games with publishing from Wadjet Eye Games and it instantly grabbed my attention.
articles.title: The Excavation of Hob's Barrow has some real fancy pixel-art

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Valve has announced that the Steam Bash Bash event will be going live between September 19 and September 26.
articles.title: September will bring the melee focused Steam Bash Bash event

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Here's one missed from earlier in July, the colourful 3D platformer Hobo Cat Adventures gained Native Linux support.
articles.title: Hobo Cat Adventures features dark humour and souls-like combat - now on Linux

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Limit Theory was a once very promising looking space sim that was funded on Kickstarter. Sadly the developer cancelled it but now as promised they've opened up the source code.
articles.title: Cancelled space sim Limit Theory opens up the source code

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Pokete is a game we introduced you too recently that's inspired by Pokémon but you play it in a terminal. A new release is out bringing some nice advancements.
articles.title: Terminal-based game inspired by Pokémon gets a big upgrade with audio

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Despite the name, VRChat is not a VR-only space and it's incredibly popular. Recently though, they added in Easy Anti-Cheat and the community is currently very unhappy with it.
articles.title: VRChat adds Easy Anti-Cheat, community not happy but Linux and Steam Deck work fine

articles.author: BTRE
articles.description: The latest entry in the Total War franchise was ported by Feral Interactive over to Linux last month. After spending a good chunk of time commanding armies and bringing chaos to the land, I have a few thoughts to share.
articles.title: Total War: Warhammer III cautiously builds upon a tried and true formula

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Have the need for speed and love a good retro first-person shooter? DIMENSIONAL SLAUGHTER is what you should take a look at.
articles.title: DIMENSIONAL SLAUGHTER is an absolutely wild sounding fast-paced retro shooter

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Need a new relaxing puzzle game that doesn't require guesswork? Recently hexceed gained a Native Linux port.
articles.title: hexceed is a free hexagonal Minesweeper out now for Linux

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Looking more promising than ever, the in-development free and open source RPG Veloren has a big new release out.
articles.title: Free and open source multiplayer voxel RPG 'Veloren' version 0.13 is out

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Black Tabby Games have just announced Slay the Princess. It's a choice-driven psychological horror visual novel / dating sim with dramatic branching, light RPG elements and hand-penciled art.
articles.title: Slay the Princess is an upcoming choice-driven psychological horror visual novel

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: GOG has announced their big Find Your Indie Sale is now live with some new releases, more upcoming games and of course lots of discounts to take a look over.
articles.title: GOG announces the major Find Your Indie Sale

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Act fast if you want to get a good free puzzle game! Kenney is giving away Pixross on itch.io and it has Native Linux support.
articles.title: Puzzle game Pixross from Kenney is free for 24 hours

articles.author: gamingonlinux
articles.description: This is the public once a month reminder to make sure your PC information is correct on your user profiles. A fresh batch of statistics is generated on the 1st of each month. Also a good reminder of our stats system for people who don't know about it.
articles.title: Reminder: Update your PC info for the next round of statistics updates

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: The Humble Deck Builder Bundle has gone live and it's another that offers some pretty interesting choices, so here's what to expect on Linux desktop and Steam Deck.
articles.title: The Humble Deck Builder Bundle is live, here's what works on Linux & Steam Deck

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: MultiVersus is a very exciting one that has a lot of people talking right now. It's a brawler much like Smash Bros made by Player First Games and Warner Bros. Games and it's already looking pretty great.
articles.title: Looks like upcoming brawler MultiVersus works great on Steam Deck & Linux desktop

articles.author: Liam Dawe
articles.description: Not afraid of Spiders? Love a good 3D platformer? A Webbing Journey is due to release next year and it looks great, plus there's a demo available right now.
articles.title: A Webbing Journey is an upcoming wholesome 3D puzzle platformer
